snippet: Toyota and other major exporters increased base monthly pay, after pressure from unions, but also in line with the government’s economic growth plan.
abstract: Toyota and other major Japanese exporters announce an increase in base monthly pay, giving a much-needed boost to country's bid to revive its economy; union leaders warn wider recovery still hinges on the fate of low-wage, informal workers who make up a growing part of Japan’s labor force.
lead_paragraph: Toyota and other major exporters increased base monthly pay, after pressure from unions, but also in line with the government’s economic growth plan.

headline.main: For First Time in Years, a Raise for Many Japanese Workers
headline.print_headline: Toyota and Other Japanese Exporters Raise Wages
